basics.name: Corinne Hoener
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Seasoned engineer with ten years of experience building technology to solve problems. Kind and empathetic coworker who reviews pull requests promptly and thoughtfully. Balances getting-thing-done with doing-things-right in order to ship successfully and reliably. Removes more code than she adds.

highlights: Managed team of senior engineers responsible for developing and maintaining Tumblr's front-end architecture, build system, and coding standards.
Set and tracked progress toward quarterly goals and provided weekly updates to senior management.
Provided regular feedback to team members via weekly one-on-one meetings and quarterly performance reviews.
Collaborated with legal and business development stakeholders to successfully open- source three team projects.
Provided technical leadership and guidance on fronted technologies for project plans.
Key participant in architecture planning and review meetings.
Developed onboarding materials and organized a week-long orientation to simultaneously onboard over 20 new engineers.
Developed, tested, and maintained product features in PHP and JavaScript.
Collaborated with designers to iterate on user interfaces.
Analyzed data from A/B testing experiments to evaluate project success.
Participated in an on-call rotation and responded to and triaged emergency breaking incidents.
Full-stack web development using PHP, MySQL, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
Basic system administration using AWS, including EC2, RDS, EBS, and S3.
Maintain / debug / refactor legacy codebase.
Translate PSD mockups into functional websites.
Collaborated in building http://gobrooklynart.org, the platform for a Brooklyn-wide open studio event with over 1,700 artists and 18,000 studio visitors participating.

work.company: Teachers College Reading and Writing Project
highlights: Gathered requirements, architected, and developed technological solutions to meet the organization's needs.
Designed and developed internal and public web applications written in PHP and JavaScript.
Provided technical support for end users.
Developed fully automated event ticketing system, including the automatic generation and emailing of PDFs with scannable barcodes for attendance tracking.

education.summary: Graduate student in clinical psychology Ph.D program. Taught two sections of an undergraduate course on statistics. Presented at academic conferences. Published in a peer-reviewed journal.
Bachelor of Arts in Psychology. Recipient of the Excellence and Equal Cost Scholarship and the Andrew J. Bernstein Prize for Best Thesis in Psychology.
